section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Fixed Penalty (Criminal Proceedings) Regulations.

subsection.content: The information set out in Part 1 of Schedule 2 is prescribed for a fixed penalty notice for the purposes of section 3(5)(b) of the Ordinance.
The information set out in Part 2 of Schedule 2 is prescribed for an electronic fixed penalty notice for the purposes of section 3(6)(b) of the Ordinance.
The information set out in Part 3 of Schedule 2 is prescribed for a demand notice for the purposes of section 3AAB(3)(b) of the Ordinance.
The information set out in Part 4 of Schedule 2 is prescribed for an electronic demand notice for the purposes of section 3AAB(4)(b) of the Ordinance.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Commissioner of Police may specify matters relating to payment of penalties in specified forms
section.leadIn: The Commissioner of Police may, in a form specified under section 11A(1) of the Ordinance, specify matters relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom and the place at which a fixed penalty or an additional penalty may be paid; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how a fixed penalty or an additional penalty may be paid.

subsection.leadIn: A person on whom a fixed penalty notice or demand notice (notice) is served may pay the fixed penalty within the period of time stated in the notice— (13 of 2024 s. 47)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by post addressed to the Treasury; (L.N. 165 of 2001; L.N. 14 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: personally or through the person’s agent at a counter of any post office other than a mobile post office; (L.N. 14 of 2018)

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: by phone by using the service commonly known as PPS; (L.N. 165 of 2001; 10 of 2008 s. 50; L.N. 14 of 2018)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: through the Internet; (L.N. 165 of 2001; L.N. 14 of 2018; 13 of 2024 s. 47)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: through the phone-banking service provided by a bank; or (L.N. 14 of 2018; 13 of 2024 s. 47)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: through any other payment method specified by the Commissioner of Police under regulation 2A in the notice. (13 of 2024 s. 47)

subsection.leadIn: A person who wishes to pay the fixed penalty in accordance with subregulation (1)(a) or (b) must— (13 of 2024 s. 47)

subparagraph.content: the notice to which the payment relates; or
if the notice is served under section 3(4) or 3AAB(2) of the Ordinance—a printed copy of the notice made available for inspection under section 3(4)(a) or 3AAB(2)(a) of the Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide the notice number or electronic payment number specified in the notice,

subsection.continued: together with the payment in accordance with the payment instructions set out in the notice. (13 of 2024 s. 47)

subsection.content: When any payment is made in accordance with this regulation, it shall be of the amount specified in the notice or, where payment is made in respect of more than one notice, of the total amounts specified in the notices.
Where any amount is paid otherwise than in accordance with this regulation, the Director of Accounting Services may return it to the payer.

Subject to subregulation (4), the Director of Accounting Services shall, as soon as practicable after payment of a fixed penalty has been made in accordance with subregulation (1)(b), send to the person paying a receipt for the payment.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Certificate of service
section.leadIn: A certificate of service under section 3AAF(1) of the Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it states the matters specified in section 3AAF(2)(a) of the Ordinance—must be in accordance with Form 2A in Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it states the matters specified in section 3AAF(2)(b) of the Ordinance—must be in accordance with Form 2B in Schedule 1.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Certificate under section 8
section.content: A certificate under section 8 of the Ordinance must be in accordance with Form 3 in Schedule 1.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Certificate under section 10
section.content: A certificate under section 10(3) of the Ordinance must be in accordance with Form 4 in Schedule 1.
